intro: Elyna caricina, commonly known as the redroot germander, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. It is known for its aromatic foliage and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine. Elyna caricina is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
